Here by ‘ inversible ’ we mean,  of course,  one-to-one.  The formal algebraic connection
between inversible Reynolds operators and derivations can be considered well-known ; see for example [ 4 ]. The theorem states this connection in a form appropriate to the present circumstances.  It will suffice to prove the second part ; the proof of the first is similar.  Suppose therefore that T has the stated properties and that D is defined by ( 1.  4 ); its domain is clearly %. This theorem characterizes the bounded Reynolds operators whose resolvent set contains 0 ; in later paragraphs we are concerned with Reynolds operators for which 0 lies in the spectrum.
